lead_paragraph: LEITMAN--Stephen Israel, died peacefully on April 22, 2016 at the age of 74, surrounded by family and friends a long battle with lung cancer. He was the quintessential New Yorker and a lover of Motown was also an avid fan of the Yankees and Giants. A Jewish American whose parents gave him the opportunity to become a Leading Educator wherever he worked; which included PS 81 and District 10 Administration in the Bronx, Beacon, Mahwah, Highland Falls and Garden City. His intense friendships and love for his synagogue (Yorktown Jewish Center) and the Somers Lions, amazing humor and absolute dedication his community made him a special person to many. From starting out as a Physical Education Teacher and rising to complete his career as a School Superintendent with a Doctorate from Fordham University where he was also an Adjunct Professor. His love for football also led him to be a Referee with the ECAC in both High School and College. He is survived by his only son, Seth Leitman, his daughter-in-law Jessica plus grandsons, Tyler and Cameron and his brother Robert. Donations in Stephen Leitman's memory can be made to the United Jewish Appeal. The Funeral Service is to be held at Congregation Sons of Israel in Briarcliff Manor, NY at 11:30am on Monday, April 25, 2016. 1/3
